intro: Escobesseya dasyacantha, commonly known as the woolly burr. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Escobesseya dasyacantha is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in savannas and grasslands.
